activities_info.details: Blood drive done at the school of medicine.

Creating infographics for flyers and posters to inform and educate the community of San Antonio with information on social distancing, correct ways to wear masks, understanding signs and symptoms, as well as next steps for care. Students are also collecting stories from "essential" workers, from doctors to nurses to grocery workers, etc. Students are also pulling information out of the incoming literature into information sheets for front line providers.
Medical students are acting as temperature screeners for those coming onto the school of medicine campus. They are also collecting and distributing PPE.
Students are helping man the San Antonio MetroHealth (city health district) provider Hotline and Epi case investigation contact tracing, the county general hotline, and VA Hospital hotline.

Support various UT Health Physician clinics with setting up patients for electronic chart systems and telehealth visits. Other students are assisting a palliative care unit's patients with their families via technology for virtual family visits.
University Hospital Systems Infectious Disease COVID Service, assisting faculty remotely with chart checks, test follow-ups, and other non-patient clinical duties.

directusSchool.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio Joe R. and Teresa Lozano Long School of Medicine
